required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Comparing Cardiovascular Effects of Ticagrelor and Clopidogrel in Patients With Peripheral Artery Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel Group, Multicentre Phase IIIb Study to Compare Ticagrelor With Clopidogrel Treatment on the Risk of Cardiovascular Death, Myocardial Infarction and Ischemic Stroke in Patients With Established Peripheral Artery Disease (EUCLID Examining Use of tiCagreLor In paD)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the effects of ticagrelor and clopidogrel in patients with Peripheral Artery Disease.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized, double-blind, parallel group, multicentre phase IIIb study to compare ticagrelor with clopidogrel treatment on the risk of cardiovascular death, myocardial infarction and ischemic stroke in patients with established Peripheral Artery Disease (EUCLID Examining Use of tiCagreLor In paD)

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
primary_outcome.description: Participants with CV death, myocardial infarction (MI) or ischemic stroke. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (primary analysis censoring date (PACD), last endpoint assessment date, non-CV death date)

secondary_outcome.measure: Composite of CV Death, MI, Ischemic Stroke, and ALI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with CV death, MI, ischemic stroke or acute limb ischemia (ALI). If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (PACD, last endpoint assessment date, non-CV death date)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with CV death. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (PACD, last endpoint assessment date, non-CV death date)

other_outcome.measure: Net Clinical Benefit (Composite of All-cause Mortality/MI/Ischemic Stroke/ALI/Major Amputation/Fatal Bleeding/Intracranial Bleeding)
other_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
other_outcome.description: Participants with all-cause death, MI, ischemic stroke, ALI, major amputation, fatal bleeding or intracranial bleeding. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (PACD, last endpoint assessment date)

other_outcome.measure: Net Clinical Benefit (Composite of All-cause Mortality/MI/Ischemic Stroke/ALI/Major Amputation/TIMI Major Bleeding)
other_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
other_outcome.description: Participants with all-cause death, MI, ischemic stroke, ALI, major amputation or Thrombolysis in Myocardial Infarction (TIMI) major bleeding. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (PACD, last endpoint assessment date)

other_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
other_outcome.description: Participants with non-CV death. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (PACD, last endpoint assessment date, CV death)

other_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
other_outcome.description: Progression of the clinical/symptomatic status of the limb by changes in Fontaine stage. Stage I - Asymptomatic Stage IIa - Intermittent claudication after more than 200 meters of pain free walking Stage IIb - Intermittent claudication after less than 200 meters of walking Stage III - Rest pain Stage IV - Ischemic ulcers or gangrene

other_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
other_outcome.description: Progression of the clinical/symptomatic status of the limb by changes in Rutherford classification. Category 0 - Asymptomatic Category 1 - Mild claudication Category 2 - Moderate claudication - The distance that delineates mild, moderate and severe claudication is not specified in the Rutherford classification, but is mentioned in the Fontaine classification as 200 meters. Category 3 - Severe claudication Category 4 - Rest pain Category 5 - Ischemic ulceration not exceeding ulcer of the digits of the foot Category 6 - Severe ischemic ulcers or frank gangrene

other_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
other_outcome.description: Change in ankle brachial index (ABI) / toe brachial index (TBI). Ankle brachial index (ABI) is the ratio of blood pressures from the ankle and arm and is used for diagnosing peripheral arterial occlusive disease (PAOD): Normal: 1 to 1.29 Borderline: 0.91 to 0.99 Mild PAOD: 0.71 to 0.90 Medium severe PAOD: 0.41 to 0.7 Severe PAOD: <0.4 Toe brachial index (TBI) is the ratio between the toe pressure and the higher brachial pressure, used for diagnosing PAOD when the ABI cannot be used: Normal: >0.7 Mild: 0.5-0.7 Moderate: 0.35-0.5 Moderate-Severe: <0.35 and toe pressure 40 mmHg Severe: <0.35 and toe pressure < 30 mmHg

other_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
other_outcome.description: Participants with any amputation caused by peripheral arterial disease (PAD). If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (PACD, last endpoint assessment date, death date)

other_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
other_outcome.description: Participants with major amputation caused by PAD. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (PACD, last endpoint assessment date, death date)

other_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
other_outcome.description: Participants with hospitalization associated with CV death, hospitalization due to MI, ischemic stroke, lower extremity revascularization, major amputation due to PAD, transient ischemic attack (TIA), coronary revascularization or unstable angina. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (PACD, last endpoint assessment date, death date)

other_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose and up to and including 7 days following the date of last dose of study drug
other_outcome.description: Participants with TIMI major bleeding event. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (last endpoint assessment date, death date, 7 days after last dose of study drug)

other_outcome.measure: TIMI Major or Minor Bleeding Events
other_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose and up to and including 7 days following the date of last dose of study drug
other_outcome.description: Participants with TIMI major or minor bleeding event. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (last endpoint assessment date, death date, 7 days after last dose of study drug)

other_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose and up to and including 7 days following the date of last dose of study drug
other_outcome.description: Participants with PLATO major bleeding event. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (last endpoint assessment date, death date, 7 days after last dose of study drug)

other_outcome.measure: Premature Permanent Discontinuation of Study Drug Due to Any Bleeding Event
other_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose and up to and including 7 days following the date of last dose of study drug
other_outcome.description: Participants with a permanent discontinuation of study drug due to any bleeding event. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (last endpoint assessment date, death date, 7 days after last dose of study drug)

arm_group.description: Ticagrelor 90 mg bd (and Clopidogrel placebo od) taken orally as tablets
Clopidogrel 75 mg od (and Ticagrelor placebo bd) taken orally as tablets

intervention.description: Ticagrelor 90 mg bd (and Clopidogrel placebo od) taken orally as tablets
Clopidogrel 75 mg od (and Ticagrelor placebo bd) taken orally as tablets

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and Female patients 50 years old or older Symptomatic peripheral artery disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients needing dual anti-platlet drug treatment before start of study Planned revascularisation or amputation
- Patients with known bleeding disorders
- Patients with a history of intracranial bleed
- Patients considered to be at risk of bradycardic events unless already treated with a permanent pacemaker

overall_official.affiliation: University of Colorado School of Medicine

clinical_study.keyword: Peripheral artery disease Atherothrombotic events Atherosclerosis

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted at 821 centres randomising patients across 28 countries. The first patient was enrolled on 04 December 2012. The last visit of the last patient took place on 26 September 2016. In total, 16237 patients were screened.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Screened patients randomised to study drug: 85.5%; n=13885 Patients who were not randomised: 14.5%; n=2352 Patients with inclusion criteria for symptomatic lower extremity PAD failed: n=489 Patients with poor metabolizer status for CYP2C19: n=616 Patients with other reason: n=1374

participants_list.participants: Includes patients who did not withdraw informed consent prior to the PACD
Includes patients who did not withdraw informed consent prior to the PACD

outcome.title: Composite of Cardiovascular (CV) Death/MI/Ischemic Stroke
outcome.description: Participants with CV death, myocardial infarction (MI) or ischemic stroke. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (primary analysis censoring date (PACD), last endpoint assessment date, non-CV death date)
outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
outcome.population: The population was the full analysis set, which included all randomized patients.

measure.title: Composite of Cardiovascular (CV) Death/MI/Ischemic Stroke
measure.description: Participants with CV death, myocardial infarction (MI) or ischemic stroke. If no event, censoring occurs at the minimum of (primary analysis censoring date (PACD), last endpoint assessment date, non-CV death date)
measure.population: The population was the full analysis set, which included all randomized patients.

analysis.p_value_desc: The hypothesis will be tested at the 4.94% two-sided significance level to account for the planned interim analysis with the overall type I error preserved at 5%. A hierarchical test sequence will be used to address the issue of multiple testing

outcome.title: Changes in Fontaine Stage
outcome.description: Progression of the clinical/symptomatic status of the limb by changes in Fontaine stage. Stage I – Asymptomatic Stage IIa – Intermittent claudication after more than 200 meters of pain free walking Stage IIb – Intermittent claudication after less than 200 meters of walking Stage III – Rest pain Stage IV – Ischemic ulcers or gangrene
outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
outcome.population: The population was the full analysis set, which included all randomized patients

measure.title: Changes in Fontaine Stage
measure.description: Progression of the clinical/symptomatic status of the limb by changes in Fontaine stage. Stage I – Asymptomatic Stage IIa – Intermittent claudication after more than 200 meters of pain free walking Stage IIb – Intermittent claudication after less than 200 meters of walking Stage III – Rest pain Stage IV – Ischemic ulcers or gangrene
measure.population: The population was the full analysis set, which included all randomized patients

outcome.title: Changes in Rutherford Classification
outcome.description: Progression of the clinical/symptomatic status of the limb by changes in Rutherford classification. Category 0 – Asymptomatic Category 1 – Mild claudication Category 2 – Moderate claudication – The distance that delineates mild, moderate and severe claudication is not specified in the Rutherford classification, but is mentioned in the Fontaine classification as 200 meters. Category 3 – Severe claudication Category 4 – Rest pain Category 5 – Ischemic ulceration not exceeding ulcer of the digits of the foot Category 6 – Severe ischemic ulcers or frank gangrene
outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
outcome.population: The population was the full analysis set, which included all randomized patients

measure.title: Changes in Rutherford Classification
measure.description: Progression of the clinical/symptomatic status of the limb by changes in Rutherford classification. Category 0 – Asymptomatic Category 1 – Mild claudication Category 2 – Moderate claudication – The distance that delineates mild, moderate and severe claudication is not specified in the Rutherford classification, but is mentioned in the Fontaine classification as 200 meters. Category 3 – Severe claudication Category 4 – Rest pain Category 5 – Ischemic ulceration not exceeding ulcer of the digits of the foot Category 6 – Severe ischemic ulcers or frank gangrene
measure.population: The population was the full analysis set, which included all randomized patients

outcome.title: Change in ABI/TBI From Baseline
outcome.description: Change in ankle brachial index (ABI) / toe brachial index (TBI). Ankle brachial index (ABI) is the ratio of blood pressures from the ankle and arm and is used for diagnosing peripheral arterial occlusive disease (PAOD): Normal: 1 to 1.29 Borderline: 0.91 to 0.99 Mild PAOD: 0.71 to 0.90 Medium severe PAOD: 0.41 to 0.7 Severe PAOD: <0.4 Toe brachial index (TBI) is the ratio between the toe pressure and the higher brachial pressure, used for diagnosing PAOD when the ABI cannot be used: Normal: >0.7 Mild: 0.5-0.7 Moderate: 0.35-0.5 Moderate-Severe: <0.35 and toe pressure 40 mmHg Severe: <0.35 and toe pressure < 30 mmHg
outcome.time_frame: From randomization to PACD, an average of 2.5 years
outcome.population: The population was the full analysis set, which included all randomized patients

measure.title: Change in ABI/TBI From Baseline
measure.description: Change in ankle brachial index (ABI) / toe brachial index (TBI). Ankle brachial index (ABI) is the ratio of blood pressures from the ankle and arm and is used for diagnosing peripheral arterial occlusive disease (PAOD): Normal: 1 to 1.29 Borderline: 0.91 to 0.99 Mild PAOD: 0.71 to 0.90 Medium severe PAOD: 0.41 to 0.7 Severe PAOD: <0.4 Toe brachial index (TBI) is the ratio between the toe pressure and the higher brachial pressure, used for diagnosing PAOD when the ABI cannot be used: Normal: >0.7 Mild: 0.5-0.7 Moderate: 0.35-0.5 Moderate-Severe: <0.35 and toe pressure 40 mmHg Severe: <0.35 and toe pressure < 30 mmHg
measure.population: The population was the full analysis set, which included all randomized patients

outcome.population: The population was the safety analysis set, which included all patients who received at least 1 dose of randomized ticagrelor or clopidogrel and for whom post-dose data are available

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
